text: this was one of two small lifeboats
launched by striking French ferry
workers the kept the port of Calais
closed for several hours much to the
annoyance of returning British
holidaymakers they're tied up to the
wall they're only eight foot wide this
ship could easily sail through but the
port authorities have refused permission
for us to leave they're not blockading
this at all
they're totally wasting our time and
their time but the authorities here and
just got this on the key side in Calais
large queues of cars built up the piano
ferry spirit of britain was kept waiting
at the dockside trying to get out of the
port and just to add to the misery there
was an intense electrical storm on board
families with young children did their
best to bed down for the night this was
just the latest direct action by French
ferry workers last month they blocked
access to the Channel Tunnel they're
protesting about the closure of the my
ferry link service that they say will
cost hundreds of jobs the port of Calais
is now open again but the disruption on
one of the busiest weekend's of the year
couldn't have come at a worse time
Andy Moore BBC News
